body:
I am not a contributor (yet) , but I think that the ARKit & ARcore could be made available developing a "plugin package" and wrapping their functionality in a common dart interface. 
Look [here](https://flutter.io/developing-packages/) if you are interested
I'm really looking forward to this!
I seriously need this feature
Currently working on a project that requires AR to be implemented. This feature would truly help!
Waiting for this for pretty long now. Would be awesome seriously

I Implemented a plugin that recognizes images via ARCore. will publish it soon . Would be cool if you guys could help me  implement new features and improve the plugin. I also want the plugin to support ARKit. Will here from me soon!
@khalithartmann where can I find the repo?
@khalithartmann: I also am interested in your code
will upload the plugin soon. will let you guys know

Hey, @khalithartmann thank you for taking the time in creating a plugin to integrate ARCore with Flutter.

I will be having a very important meeting early next month where I would need to demonstrate an AR prototype for a client. I would really love to use Flutter as the UI Creation and Experience is simply, amazing. 

So I was just wondering if there was anything I could help out with that could potentially speed up your release? Otherwise, I might have to look into other options for this prototype.

I'd also be happy to help, as we also face the decision, whether we can use flutter.




Outlook für Android herunterladen







On Mon, Mar 11, 2019 at 3:07 PM +0100, "JosephSaw" <notifications@github.com> wrote:












Hey, @khalithartmann thank you for taking the time in creating a plugin to integrate ARCore with Flutter.


I will be having a very important meeting early next month where I would need to demonstrate an AR prototype for a client. I would really love to use Flutter as the UI Creation and Experience is simply, amazing.


So I was just wondering if there was anything I could help out with that could potentially speed up your release? Otherwise, I might have to look into other options for this prototype.



—
You are receiving this because you commented.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.

I just  published the plugin. Help is always appreciated!
https://pub.dartlang.org/packages/arcore_plugin/versions/0.0.1
Need some help integrating it @khalithartmann
hey @knightcube , how can i help you ?
I wanted to understand how to load the images in the Augmented Database in Flutter. I think raising an issue in the plugin's repo would be good. Will do that tomorrow
Ah and as for now you cant train the IMGDB in the app. you have to pretrain it with the arcoreimg tool. see  https://developers.google.com/ar/develop/c/augmented-images/arcoreimg

Does the plugin and example run under ios? 

I get lots of errors, where I am not sure, whether this is due to config errors on my side, or due to missing ios implementation?

 

Thanks

 

Von: khalithartmann <notifications@github.com>
Antworten an: flutter/flutter <reply@reply.github.com>
Datum: Freitag, 8. März 2019 um 22:20
An: flutter/flutter <flutter@noreply.github.com>
Cc: hellowtisch <marcel@hellofaservice.de>, Comment <comment@noreply.github.com>
Betreff: Re: [flutter/flutter] Integrating ARKIT and ARCORE with flutter (#22860)

 

will upload the plugin soon. will let you guys know

—
You are receiving this because you commented.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
Hey no the plugin does not support IOS because ARCore only supports android

Hey arcore also Supports iOS, according to the specs, that's why your plugin is so important




Outlook für Android herunterladen







On Mon, Mar 18, 2019 at 10:11 AM +0100, "khalithartmann" <notifications@github.com> wrote:












Hey no the plugin does not support IOS because ARCore only supports android



—
You are receiving this because you commented.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.

Currently only the cloud anchors functionality is supported for IOS. The Image recognition functionality is not supported as stated in the documentation. Could you explain to me what you mean by "Hey arcore also Supports iOS, according to the specs" ? Do you have a link or something like that ? Maybe you could help adding the IOS support for the plugin if its possible

Hi!

You can find a ARKit puglin!
https://pub.dartlang.org/packages/arkit_plugin#-changelog-tab-

And the repo
https://github.com/olexale/arkit_flutter_plugin

+1 for support for an isomorphic AR solution for Flutter with iOS + Android. Seems like integrating ARCore for Android and ARKit for iOS would be a winning combination. My use case is primarily image detection, and it sounds like ARCore has no plans to support it on iOS. Maybe a new plugin will be born to combine [arkit_plugin](https://pub.dev/packages/arkit_plugin) and [arcore_plugin](https://pub.dev/packages/arcore_plugin).
Would be nice, also waiting for that.
wait for this feature.
A single plugin for both ARCore and ARKit would be incredible.

Thanks for the plugin, I really love it. I am curious about **ARcore** and **ARkit**, What is the different between the two? Can I use both on the same project?

 THANKS

> 
> 
> Hi!
> 
> You can find a ARKit puglin!
> https://pub.dartlang.org/packages/arkit_plugin#-changelog-tab-
> 
> And the repo
> https://github.com/olexale/arkit_flutter_plugin

Is it just for ios or is it also support android?
Any update on this? I am really looking forward for a standard solution for flutter
hey, if we can get a single plugin for both ARCore and ARKit, that'd be great, you have my vote on this one!
